TextJPN: 夕食まで特に何もする気も起きず、ただぼーっと…放心して過ごしていた。
TextENG: I was out of it and couldn't bring myself to do anything until dinner except stare blankly into space.

TextJPN: 俺はレナに逆上されて…恐怖していた？
TextENG: Was I terrified from Rena going off on me?

TextJPN: …いや違う。
TextENG: ...No, that's not right.

TextJPN: あれはレナに似た別物だった。
TextENG: That was someone else who only looked like Rena.

TextJPN: じゃあ……あれは誰だったんだ？
TextENG: Then... who could it have been?

TextJPN: そういう恐ろしい気持ち。
TextENG: It was a dreadful feeling...

TextJPN: あれとレナは別人なんだから、明日、レナとはいつものように話せるよな。
TextENG: ...Knowing that that was someone else, not Rena. So tomorrow I shouldn't have a problem talking to Rena like I usually do.

TextJPN: そういう奇妙な安堵。
TextENG: That thought was strangely comforting.

TextJPN: 今は何も考えずに、頭を空っぽにすべきだという理性。
TextENG: I concluded that I should just calm down and clear my head.

TextJPN: …それらが頭の中でごちゃまぜになり、ずっと騒いでいるだけだった。
TextENG: ...Though those thoughts continued swirling around my mind.

TextJPN: ふと意識が戻り、階下の母が呼んでいるのが聞こえた。
TextENG: Finally, I returned to my senses as I heard my mother calling out to me from the bottom of the stairs.
``Keiichi~!@k@vS01/00/122700007. It's a call from the bookstore~.``

TextJPN: 本屋？@k　電話を受けるような覚えはない。
TextENG: Bookstore?@k Can't think of why they'd be calling me.

TextJPN: …とりあえず階下に下り、受話器を取った。
TextENG: ...I went downstairs and picked up the receiver anyway.

TextJPN: 「夜分遅くに申し訳ありません。@k@vS01/11/120700120.私、興宮書房の大石と申します」
TextENG: ``My apologies for calling so late at night.@k@vS01/11/120700120. It's me, Ooishi of the Okinomiya bookshop.``

TextJPN: 「大石さん？@k@vS01/01/120100220.　…大石さんじゃないですか！」
TextENG: ``Ooishi-san?@k@vS01/01/120100220. ...Oh, it's Ooishi-san!``

TextJPN: 「ごめんなさいね。@k@vS01/11/120700122.ご両親が出られたので本屋さんということにしておきました。@k@vS01/11/120700123.警察ですって名乗ると、いろいろ気分を害されるでしょうしね」
TextENG: ``Sorry.@k@vS01/11/120700122. Since your parents picked up I said I was from the bookstore.@k@vS01/11/120700123. It puts people off when I say I'm a police officer.``

TextJPN: 大石さんなりに気を遣ってくれたつもりらしい。
TextENG: Ooishi-san was, in his own way, rather courteous.

TextJPN: それでも警察の人と話をしているところを親に見られたくない。
TextENG: Even so, I didn't want my parents hearing me talk to the police.

TextJPN: …俺は子機に持ち替えると２階の自分の部屋へ駆け戻った。
TextENG: ...I brought the cordless phone with me as I dashed back up to my room on the second floor.

TextJPN: 「夜分遅くにすみませんですね。@k@vS01/11/120700125.実は昨日お渡しした電話番号のメモ、あれ古い番号だったんです。@k@vS01/11/120700126.本当に申し訳ない。@k@vS01/11/120700127.これから申し上げる番号を控えておいてもらえますか？」
TextENG: ``Sorry for calling so late.@k@vS01/11/120700125. That phone number on the piece of paper I gave you yesterday was the old number.@k@vS01/11/120700126. My apologies.@k@vS01/11/120700127. Can you copy down the number I'm about to give you?``

TextJPN: 職場の直通番号を教えてもらい、それを書き留める。
TextENG: He gave me the number for his direct line as I wrote it down.

TextJPN: それだけで用件が終わりかと思ったが、下らない世間話が始まり、なかなか電話を切らせようとはしなかった。
TextENG: I thought that was the end of it, but he began making pointless small talk, and it was pretty hard to hang up.

TextJPN: 「さてどうでしょう、前原さん。@k@vS01/11/120700129.何か変わった事はありましたか？」
TextENG: ``So how has it been, Maebara-san?@k@vS01/11/120700129. Did anything strange happen recently?``

TextJPN: …なるほど。@kこれが本題だ。
TextENG: ...I see.@k This was the real reason.

TextJPN: まわりくどい、大人的な話術にしばし閉口する。
TextENG: He really beat around the bush there. His adult conversational skills left me slack-jawed.

TextJPN: 「大石さんは…ここの、地元の方ですか？」
TextENG: ``Are you... from around here, Ooishi-san?``

TextJPN: 「ええ、そうです。@k@vS01/11/120700131.生まれも育ちも興宮ですよ」
TextENG: ``Yeah, I am.@k@vS01/11/120700131. Born and raised in Okinomiya.``

TextJPN: 地元の人間なら…知っているかもしれない。
TextENG: If he's from around here... he might know.

TextJPN: 「あの、大石さん。@k@vS01/01/120100225.……『鬼隠し』って何の事か知ってますか？」
TextENG: ``Um, Ooishi-san.@k@vS01/01/120100225. ...Do you know what this 'Onikakushi' thing is about?'``

TextJPN: 「ん、…それはですね、人が鬼にさらわれ忽然といなくなってしまうことなんです。@k@vS01/11/120700133.このあたり独特の言い回しですね。@k@vS01/11/120700134.世間様で言う、神隠しと同じ意味です」
TextENG: ``Hm... I believe... that's when somebody suddenly vanishes because they've been abducted by a demon.@k@vS01/11/120700133. It's a special saying from around here.@k@vS01/11/120700134. It has the same meaning as 'spirited away' like everyone else says.``

TextJPN: 仲間から聞く事もかなわないことを、歳すら大きく離れているこのおっさんは即答してくれる。
TextENG: Whereas my friends would say they didn't know when I asked... this older man gave me a direct answer.

TextJPN: ……その包み隠さない即答ぶりが少しだけ嬉しかった。
TextENG: ...It made me a bit happy that he answered me directly without trying to hide anything.

TextJPN: 「雛見沢は、……うーん、前原さんにこんなこと言っていいんでしょうか」
TextENG: ``Hinamizawa was... um, not sure if I should tell you this, Maebara-san.``

TextJPN: 「もったいぶらないで下さいよ。@k@vS01/01/120100227.大石さんが言わないなら俺も何もいいませんよ！」
TextENG: ``Don't try to play this off.@k@vS01/01/120100227. If you're not going to talk, then I'm not going to tell you anything!``

TextJPN: 「あ、いやいや！@k@vS01/11/120700137.　そういう意味じゃないんですよ。ただその、気を悪くされないかと思いましてね。@k@vS01/11/120700138.………実はですね、雛見沢はその昔、鬼の住む里って呼ばれて恐れられていたんですよ」
TextENG: ``Ah, no no!@k@vS01/11/120700137. That's not what I meant.  It's just... it may make you feel bad.@k@vS01/11/120700138. ...You see... long ago, Hinamizawa was feared as the village where demons reside.``

TextJPN: 「鬼？@k@vS01/01/120100229.　鬼って地獄にいる、金棒を持ったあの？」
TextENG: ``Demons?@k@vS01/01/120100229. By demons you mean... those pitchfork-carrying things in Hell?``

TextJPN: 「う～ん、というよりは人食い鬼ですなぁ。@k@vS01/11/120700140.里に降りてきて人をさらって食い散らかしてしまう、なぁんて怖ぁい昔話があるんですよ」
TextENG: ``Hmm~ more like human-eating monsters.@k@vS01/11/120700140. They'd go down to villages snatching people up and gobbling them down. That kind of tale.``

TextJPN: この、鬼が人をさらってしまうことを本来、『鬼隠し』というらしい。
TextENG: Demons snatching up people is what this ``Onikakushi`` really means.

TextJPN: 「…祟りと鬼隠しは一緒に起こるって言ってましたけど。@k@vS01/01/120100231.…どういうことですか？」
TextENG: ``...They said that the curse and being demoned away happen together.@k@vS01/01/120100231. ...What does that mean?``

TextJPN: ５年連続で人が怪死していることはすでに知っている。
TextENG: I already knew about the mysterious deaths happening five years in a row.

TextJPN: …だが、それと同時に５年連続で人が消えているという話は聞いていない。
TextENG: ...But I didn't know there were people disappearing for those same five years.

TextJPN: 「祟りと鬼隠しが必ず一緒に？@k@vS01/11/120700142.　それは初めて聞きました。@k@vS01/11/120700143.そうなんですか前原さん？」
TextENG: ``The curse and being demoned away happen together?@k@vS01/11/120700142. First time I've heard of that.@k@vS01/11/120700143. Is that how it is, Maebara-san?``

TextJPN: 「それは俺が聞きたいですよ。@k@vS01/01/120100233.…レナと魅音が話してたんです。オヤシロさまの祟りなら必ず、祟りと鬼隠しが起こるって」
TextENG: ``That's what I want to know.@k@vS01/01/120100233. ...I heard Rena and Mion talking. They said that if it was really Oyashiro-sama's curse, then both the curse and demoning away would happen.``

TextJPN: 大石さんは受話器の向こうでうなり始める。
TextENG: Ooishi-san began hemming and hawing on the other end of the receiver.

TextJPN: ……思い当たるフシがあるのだろうか。
TextENG: ...Maybe something about that came to mind?

TextJPN: 「前原さん。@k@vS01/11/120700145.最初の事件、ご存じですよね？」
TextENG: ``Maebara-san.@k@vS01/11/120700145. Do you know the first incident?``

TextJPN: 「えぇ。@k@vS01/01/120100235.６人の犯人の内、１人はまだ逃走中なんですよね？」
TextENG: ``Yeah.@k@vS01/01/120100235. One of the six perpetrators is still on the run, right?``

TextJPN: 「たとえばそれ。@k@vS01/11/120700148.……逃走中じゃなく、鬼隠しにあったんじゃないでしょうかね？」
TextENG: ``Hypothetically...@k@vS01/11/120700148. What if he isn't on the run, but was demoned away?``

TextJPN: え？！@k　……それは大石さんの、あまりに大胆な仮説だった。
TextENG: Huh!?@k ...It was an outrageous hypothesis from Ooishi-san.

TextJPN: ４年前の事件は稀に見る凶悪な事件。
TextENG: The incident four years ago was the particularly ghastly one.

TextJPN: 犯人はすでに特定されていた。
TextENG: The police already knew the perpetrators.

TextJPN: 警察は顔写真入りの手配書を多量に刷った。
TextENG: So they posted tons of wanted posters with his face on them.

TextJPN: あらゆる場所に目を光らせ、その逃走路をきつく締め上げていたはずだ。
TextENG: They staked out various locations and investigated every possible escape route he had.

TextJPN: だが…４年経った今日でも手がかりはない。@k……警察が無能でないなら。
TextENG: But... after four years, there wasn't even a hint of where he might be.@k ...Unless the police were completely incompetent.

TextJPN: そんな大胆な仮説も…今は笑い飛ばせない。
TextENG: Even if it was an outrageous hypothesis, I couldn't simply laugh it off...

TextJPN: 「じゃあ、その翌年の事故はどうです？@k@vS01/01/120100237.　誘致派の男と妻が一緒に事故死したんですよね？」
TextENG: ``Then what about the incident the next year?@k@vS01/01/120100237. When the man who supported the project and his wife both died in an accident?``

TextJPN: 「実はですね。@k@vS01/11/120700150.……正式には事故死したのは夫だけなんです。@k@vS01/11/120700151.妻は死体が上がりませんでしたから。@k@vS01/11/120700152.………現行法では死体が発見されない限り行方不明扱いなんですよ」
TextENG: ``Well, actually.@k@vS01/11/120700150. ...It was only the husband who died in an accident.@k@vS01/11/120700151. His wife's body never surfaced.@k@vS01/11/120700152. ...Unless we find the body, then it's considered a missing person by law.``

TextJPN: 事故当時、崖下の川は増水し濁流となっていたという。
TextENG: At the time of the incident, with the river below the cliff being muddy rapids...

TextJPN: 数十キロに及ぶ本流支流を警察のダイバーがくまなく捜したが、結局、妻の死体は見つからなかった。
TextENG: The police divers had searched every branch off the main stream of the river for dozens of miles. But in the end, they weren't able to find her body.

TextJPN: 「でも…死体が見つからないだけで、亡くなったんですよね？@k@vS01/01/120100239.　鬼隠しとは違うんじゃないですか…？」
TextENG: ``But... That's just them not being able to find the body. She's still dead, right?@k@vS01/01/120100239. Isn't it different from her being demoned away...?``

TextJPN: 「死体が出ない以上、亡くなったとは言えません。@k@vS01/11/120700154.法律で定めた年月が過ぎるまで生存扱いなんです」
TextENG: ``We cannot say someone is dead without their body.@k@vS01/11/120700154. Until a certain number of years pass, by law she's treated as still alive.``

TextJPN: これを鬼隠しと呼んでいいかわからない…。
TextENG: I'm not sure if it was right to call that being demoned away...

TextJPN: 妻は行方不明。
TextENG: The wife is missing.

TextJPN: これだけが事実だ。
TextENG: At least that part was reality.
``How about the 3rd year?@k@vS01/01/120100241. The Shinto priest died of illness.@k@vS01/01/120100242. And his wife committed suicide...?``

TextJPN: 「前原さん。@k@vS01/11/120700156.実はね、これもまぁったく同じなんですよ」
TextENG: ``Maebara-san.@k@vS01/11/120700156. That's actually the exact same scenario.``

TextJPN: 妻は雛見沢の奥にある底無し沼に身を投げたらしいのだ。
TextENG: The wife had supposedly thrown herself into the bottomless swamp deep in the forest around Hinamizawa.

TextJPN: ……つまり、状況証拠だけ。
TextENG: ...Meaning it's all circumstantial evidence.

TextJPN: 遺書と沼の前に揃えられたぞうりだけ…。
TextENG: They simply found her suicide note in front of the swamp...

TextJPN: …ダイバーが沼に潜りいくつかの遺品を回収したが肝心の死体は発見できなかった。
TextENG: ...A diver was able to recover a few of her articles, but they weren't able to find a body.

TextJPN: 捜査本部は擬装自殺の疑いから、重要参考人として今日も捜索中だという。
TextENG: The investigative headquarters believed that she had faked her death and was still alive somewhere.

TextJPN: 「これらを鬼隠しと呼んでいいかはちょぉっとわかりませんがね。@k@vS01/11/120700158.前原さんの言う通り、確かに毎年１人、行方不明になっています」
TextENG: ``I'm not sure if we could refer these cases as being demoned away.@k@vS01/11/120700158. It's just as you've said. Every year, one person does go missing.``

TextJPN: 「今年の事件では…富竹さんの連れの女の人が行方不明……。@k@vS01/01/120100244.……じゃあ去年の主婦の撲殺事件はどうです？@k@vS01/01/120100245.　誰か行方不明になりましたか？@k@vS01/01/120100246.　…確か犯人は逮捕されたんですよね？」
TextENG: ``The incident this year... The woman with Tomitake-san has gone missing...@k@vS01/01/120100244. Then what about the incident with the housewife beaten to death?@k@vS01/01/120100245. Who went missing?@k@vS01/01/120100246. ...I believe the perpetrator was caught, right?``

TextJPN: 「えぇ逮捕されてます。@k@vS01/11/120700160.以前に逮捕歴もあるヤツでしてね。@k@vS01/11/120700161.別件で取調べ中に犯行を自供してます。@k@vS01/11/120700162.………ですがですね。@k@vS01/11/120700163.犯人逮捕からしばらくして、被害者宅の子供が行方不明になったんです」
TextENG: ``Yeah, we arrested him.@k@vS01/11/120700160.  He already had a criminal record from before.@k@vS01/11/120700161. He admitted to the crime while being questioned about a different incident.@k@vS01/11/120700162. But... well, you see...@k@vS01/11/120700163. After he was arrested... a child from the victim's home went missing.``

TextJPN: 「犯罪に巻きこまれたのかどうなのか……。@k@vS01/11/120700165.現在も捜査してます」
TextENG: ``It's still under investigation...@k@vS01/11/120700165. As to whether the disappearance had anything to do with the crime.``

TextJPN: 「だって犯人は捕まったんですよね？@k@vS01/01/120100248.　それともその仲間が？！」
TextENG: ``But you said you caught him, right?@k@vS01/01/120100248. Did he have an accomplice!?``

TextJPN: 「さぁ…多分単独犯だと思います。@k@vS01/11/120700167.もっとも、今では確かめようもないんですよ。@k@vS01/11/120700168.……実はその男、取り調べ中に、拘置所内でお亡くなりになっちゃいまして」
TextENG: ``No idea... It was most likely only the one perpetrator.@k@vS01/11/120700167. Moreover, we can't even check now.@k@vS01/11/120700168. ...Because while under investigation, that man... he died in his holding cell.``

TextJPN: 食事用の先割れスプーンを喉に詰まらせ窒息死したというのだ。
TextENG: He swallowed a spork and choked to death.

TextJPN: 自殺なのか事故なのかはよくわからなかったという。
TextENG: It's not known whether it was an accident or suicide.

TextJPN: 「つまり…………過去５年間、必ず死者と行方不明者が１人ずつ出ているわけなんですよね…？」
TextENG: ``Meaning... for the last five years there's always one person who dies and one who goes missing...?``

TextJPN: 「そうなります。@k@vS01/11/120700170.……いえね、私も驚いていますよ。@k@vS01/11/120700171.こんな共通項には気付きませんでした」
TextENG: ``That's about right.@k@vS01/11/120700170. No, actually, I'm surprised as well.@k@vS01/11/120700171. I never realized they had that in common.``

TextJPN: これが事件解決の糸口になるとは思わない。
TextENG: I couldn't believe that this could help lead to the closing of those incidents.

TextJPN: …単なる共通項でしかない。
TextENG: ...It was just something they had in common.

TextJPN: 「……たとえば…鬼隠しにあって失踪した人には…何か共通点があるとか？」
TextENG: ``...Could it be... that those demoned away... have something in common?``

TextJPN: 大石さんはう～んとうなり思案している様子だ。
TextENG: Ooishi-san mumbled as he seemed to be thinking about it.

TextJPN: 代わりに俺が整理する。
TextENG: So I summarized the events.

TextJPN: 「１年目はダムの作業員。@k@vS01/01/120100252.２年目は誘致派の男の妻。@k@vS01/01/120100253.３年目は神主の妻。@k@vS01/01/120100254.４年目は被害者宅の子供で、５年目は交際相手…かな。@k@vS01/01/120100255.……特につながりはなさそうだし」
TextENG: ``The first year was the dam employee.@k@vS01/01/120100252. Second year was the wife of a dam project supporter.@k@vS01/01/120100253. Third year was the wife of the Shinto priest.@k@vS01/01/120100254. Fourth year was the victim's family's child, and the fifth year was the victim's girlfriend... I guess.@k@vS01/01/120100255. ...It doesn't seem like there's anything that connects them.``

TextJPN: 「１年目はともかく、妻とか交際相手とか、…そういう人が目立ちますなぁ」
TextENG: ``With the exception of the first year... wives and girlfriends... those do stand out.``

TextJPN: …確かに多いように感じた。
TextENG: ...It does seem like there are a lot.

TextJPN: だとすると…４年目の被害者宅の子供というのが変わっている。
TextENG: Then that means... The fourth year's victim's child was different.

TextJPN: 夫婦ごとの被害が目立つのに、ここだけ夫婦でなく、親子だ。
TextENG: It would have really stood out if it were all married couples... except it's not just married couples, but parents and children as well.

TextJPN: …そう言えば…確か富竹さんも『弟本人は生きていて引っ越した』みたいなことを話してくれた気がする。
TextENG: ...Come to think of it... I believe Tomitake-san also told me ``The younger brother is alive and has moved,`` if I recall correctly.

TextJPN: 「４年目に行方不明になった子供って…どんなだったんですか？」
TextENG: ``The child that went missing in the fourth year... who were they?``

TextJPN: 「大人しい感じの方だったらしいです。@k@vS01/11/120700174.歳はあなたのひとつ上です」
TextENG: ``Apparently, he was quite mature.@k@vS01/11/120700174. One year older than you.``

TextJPN: 「名前は北条悟史さん」
TextENG: ``His name was Satoshi Houjou-san.``
``...Huh? Satoshi...!?!?``

TextJPN: 聞き覚えのある名前だった。
TextENG: I remembered that name.

TextJPN: …確か悟史ってのは、去年、転校して行ったって言ってた……？！
TextENG: ...Didn't they tell me Satoshi transferred out last year...!?

TextJPN: 「あなたの学校に去年まで通っていました。@k@vS01/11/120700177.話を聞いていませんか？」
TextENG: ``He was at your school up until last year.@k@vS01/11/120700177. Didn't they tell you anything about him?``

TextJPN: そう言えば……転校してきて、席に案内された時、『転校した生徒の席』だと言われたような気がする…？？
TextENG: Come to think of it... when I transferred in, I believe they said my seat ``belonged to a recent transfer student...``?

TextJPN: じゃあ……俺が座ってる席は……鬼隠しにあって……失踪した男の席なんだ？！
TextENG: Then... where I sat... ...Once belonged to the one who was demoned away. ...It was his seat!?

TextJPN: 俺は…机の天板の、ひんやりとした手触りを思い出し、ぞっとする…。
TextENG: I recalled the cold sensation that came from that desk... it made my hair stand on end...

TextJPN: 連続怪死事件は…いや、オヤシロさまの祟りはとうとう……俺につながったのだ。
TextENG: This string of mysterious deaths... No, Oyashiro-sama's curse... I now knew how it connected to me.

TextJPN: だから、あの冷たい手触りは……オヤシロさまに首筋を撫でられたような、…そんな感触なのだ…。
TextENG: That chilling sensation... it was the feeling of Oyashiro-sama caressing the back of my neck.

TextJPN: 「………オヤシロさまの祟り、か」
TextENG: ``...Oyashiro-sama's curse... huh?``

TextJPN: ……本当に…オヤシロさまの祟りは実在するんだろうか？
TextENG: ...Could Oyashiro-sama's curse... really exist?

TextJPN: 正直に白状する。
TextENG: In all honesty...

TextJPN: …俺はオヤシロさまの祟りを信じている。
TextENG: ...I was beginning to believe it.

TextJPN: そして怖い。
TextENG: ...And I was scared.

TextJPN: …だからこそ、祟りなんかじゃなく、何者かの起こした陰謀であると決めつけたい。
TextENG: ...That was why I wanted to say it was a plot crafted by man and not the work of a curse.

TextJPN: だが…調べても調べても、それらしい気配はない。
TextENG: But... the more I dug into it, the less likely that seemed.

TextJPN: いや、むしろ調べれば調べるほどに不可解さは増していくばかりだ。
TextENG: No... the more I dug, the more mysterious it became.

TextJPN: …このまま調べていくと……やがて、………本当に知ってはいけないことにまで、辿り着いてしまうかもしれない…。
TextENG: ...If I kept digging... eventually... ...I'd reach the point where I'd learn something I really shouldn't know...

TextJPN: このまま知らずに過ごすことと、後悔するかもしれない答えを求めて深入りを続けるのと、@k…果たしてどちらが俺にとって幸せなのだろう。
TextENG: To either be none the wiser or to seek an answer I may regret...@k ...Which one would I be happier with?

TextJPN: ひょっとすると……来年の祟りは自分かもしれない。
TextENG: Maybe... it'll be me next time.

TextJPN: …それは１年間だけの執行猶予。
TextENG: ...My execution could only be delayed for one year.

TextJPN: …そこで俺は思い出す。@k…レナだ。
TextENG: ...That was when I remembered...@k Rena...

TextJPN: レナは、次の祟りの犠牲者こそ自分だと言っていた。
TextENG: Rena said she may be the next victim of the curse.

TextJPN: 「…竜宮レナさんがですか？@k@vS01/11/120700179.　去年転校されて来た、前原さんのクラスメイトですよね。@k@vS01/11/120700180.……女の子には刺激の強い事件ばかりです。@k@vS01/11/120700181.怖がるのも無理ないんじゃないでしょうかね？」
TextENG: ``...You mean Rena Ryuugu-san?@k@vS01/11/120700179. She transferred in last year and she's your classmate, isn't she?@k@vS01/11/120700180. ...These incidents really might be a bit too disturbing for a girl.@k@vS01/11/120700181. She's not just scared, is she?``

TextJPN: そんなのじゃない。
TextENG: It wasn't that.

TextJPN: 次こそ自分だとはっきり言った。
TextENG: She said it might be her next.

TextJPN: 具体的な心当たりがあるとしか思えないような言い方だった。
TextENG: She said it in a way that made me think she had a concrete reason behind it.

TextJPN: 「…もっと確信じみたものだったように思います。@k@vS01/01/120100260.……なんていうのか、その…、」
TextENG: ``...It felt like she was convinced.@k@vS01/01/120100260. ...Almost as if... um, you could say...``

TextJPN: レナの怯え。
TextENG: She was frightened.

TextJPN: レナの豹変。
TextENG: Her sudden change in demeanor.

TextJPN: レナに似た、レナじゃない誰か…。
TextENG: That someone who looked like Rena, but wasn't Rena...

TextJPN: …それは関係のない話なのか。
TextENG: ...That might be unrelated.

TextJPN: 今日一日、レナに感じた違和感がぶり返す。
TextENG: All the strange things that I felt from Rena today came back to me.

TextJPN: 「そうですか…。@k@vS01/11/120700183.ではこちらでも少し調べてみます。@k@vS01/11/120700184.前原さんも少し竜宮さんの様子に注意してあげて下さい」
TextENG: ``I see...@k@vS01/11/120700183. Then I'll be doing a bit of investigating on this end.@k@vS01/11/120700184. Please continue your observations of Ryuugu-san, Maebara-san.``

TextJPN: 「…それは…レナを見張れってことですか？」
TextENG: ``...Are you... asking me to keep Rena under surveillance?``

TextJPN: 「そんな意味ではありませんよ前原さん。@k@vS01/11/120700186.お友達が次の被害者にならないよう、少し気にしてあげて欲しいということです」
TextENG: ``That's not what I mean, Maebara-san.@k@vS01/11/120700186. I just want you to watch out for your friend so she doesn't end up the next victim.``

TextJPN: 本当に大人的な、うまい言い回しをするなぁと感心し、閉口しかけた時…、
TextENG: At that moment, just as my mouth was agape because I was so impressed with his mature, clever way with words...

TextJPN: ドンドン！
TextENG: Knock knock!

TextJPN: 突然のノック音に心臓が飛びあがった。
TextENG: A sudden knock at the door sent my heart racing.

TextJPN: 咄嗟に、意味もなく受話器を隠してしまう。
TextENG: In an instant, I had pointlessly covered up the end of the receiver.

TextJPN: 「圭一～、ちょっとここを開けてくれ～」
TextENG: ``Keiichi~ Get the door, please~.``

TextJPN: ドアの向こうから親父の妙に機嫌の良さそうな声がした。@k…なんだ？
TextENG: On the other side of the door, I heard my father's oddly upbeat voice.@k ...What could it be?

TextJPN: しかもこんな時間に。
TextENG: It's so late...

TextJPN: 「すみません、親父が来ました。@k@vS01/01/120100263.…今夜はこれくらいでいいですか？」
TextENG: ``Sorry, my dad just came in.@k@vS01/01/120100263. ...Can we leave it at this for tonight?``

TextJPN: 「えぇ。@k@vS01/11/120700188.夜分遅くに本当に申し訳ありませんでしたね。@k@vS01/11/120700189.…何かわかりましたら教えて下さい。@k@vS01/11/120700190.こちらも進展がありましたらご報告しますよ。@k@vS01/11/120700191.では失礼します」
TextENG: ``Yeah.@k@vS01/11/120700188. My apologies again for calling so late.@k@vS01/11/120700189. ...If you find out anything else, please let me know.@k@vS01/11/120700190. I'll tell you if I make any progress on this end.@k@vS01/11/120700191. Well then, have a pleasant evening.``

TextJPN: 「圭一～、早く開けてくれ～。@k@vS01/00/122600003.父さん、両手がふさがってるんだー」
TextENG: ``Keiichi~ hurry and open up~@k@vS01/00/122600003. Daddy's got his hands full.``

TextJPN: 何やってんだ親父…。
TextENG: What is Dad doing...?

TextJPN: 長い時間、同じ格好で電話をしていたので、立ち上がると体の節々が痛んだ。
TextENG: I had stayed in the same position while on the phone the whole time, so my joints were aching.

TextJPN: 扉を開くと、親父が両手でお盆を持って立っていた。
TextENG: When I opened the door, I saw my father was standing there with a tray.

TextJPN: お盆の上には…うちじゃ貴重品のクッキーと紅茶のティーカップが２つ。
TextENG: On that tray, cookies and two cups of black tea. A fairly fancy spread for our household.

TextJPN: 角砂糖にレモンスライス付き。至れり尽せりだ。
TextENG: There was even sugar and lemon slices on the side. Everything you could ask for.

TextJPN: ……どう見てもサービスが良過ぎるぞ。
TextENG: ...This was quite the show of hospitality.
``Wh-What's going on, Dad?@k@vS01/01/120100265. ...What's all this for??``

TextJPN: 「もーぅ、はぐらかすなよ圭一～。@k@vS01/00/122600005.入るぞー」
TextENG: ``Come, now. Don't play around, Keiichi~@k@vS01/00/122600005. I'm coming in~.``

TextJPN: 親父はにやにや笑うほどの上機嫌だ。
TextENG: Dad was in high spirits and had a smirk on his face.

TextJPN: しかし…生まれてこの方、こんなサービスをされた覚えはない。
TextENG: But... for my entire life, I've never seen him act this hospitable.

TextJPN: …一体、どういう風の吹き回しだ？
TextENG: ...What had gotten into him?

TextJPN: 「…で、何の話をしてたんだ？」
TextENG: ``So... what were you talking about?``

TextJPN: ぎくりとする。
TextENG: I jumped.

TextJPN: ……親父に隠さなければならない話ではないが、@k…警察の刑事（なのかな？）と夜に電話しているなんて、うまく説明できない。
TextENG: ...It's not something I had to keep from my father...@k But how could I explain to him I was talking to a detective (I'm assuming he was) this late at night?
``N-N-Nothing much...@k@vS01/01/120100267. Just a friend...!``
``I don't mean the phone.@k@vS01/00/122600008. She was here, wasn't she?@k@vS01/00/122600009. Rena-chan.``

TextJPN: 「……来てないよ？」
TextENG: ``...She wasn't here.``

TextJPN: 「も～、誤魔化さなくったっていいぞ～！@k@vS01/00/122600011.　さっきレナちゃんが遊びに来てたじゃないか。@k@vS01/00/122600012.だいぶ話しこんでるみたいだったから、お茶でも、って思ったらすれ違いだったんだよ」
TextENG: ``Come now! Don't try to keep it from me~!@k@vS01/00/122600011. She just came over to play.@k@vS01/00/122600012. You two were chatting away, so I thought I'd bring some tea, but looks like I just missed her.``

TextJPN: 親父の言っている話がよく理解できない。
TextENG: I had no idea what Dad was talking about.

TextJPN: ……なのに、俺の背中を凍るくらい冷たい汗がどろりと流れる。
TextENG: ...But a cold sweat dripped down my back.

TextJPN: 「ど、……どのくらい話し込んでたかな…？」
TextENG: ``H... How long were we talking...?``

TextJPN: 「レナちゃんが２階に上がったのが半くらいだったから…小１時間くらいかな？」
TextENG: ``Rena-chan went upstairs about half after... so it was close to an hour, I guess?``

TextJPN: 「２階に上がったの……父さん見たの？」
TextENG: ``You saw her... come up to the second floor?``

TextJPN: 「あぁ見たよ。@k@vS01/00/122600015.圭一の部屋は階段を上がって奥の扉だよって声もかけた」
TextENG: ``Yeah, I did.@k@vS01/00/122600015. I also told her that your room was the door down the hall up the stairs.``

TextJPN: レナが１時間前に俺の家にやって来た。@k…親父が玄関に迎えて…２階の俺に声をかけた。
TextENG: Rena came to my house about an hour ago.@k ...Dad met her at the door... and called out to me on the second floor.

TextJPN: きっと、大石さんの電話に集中していて…聞こえなかったに違いない…。
TextENG: (I probably didn't hear him because I was so focused on my conversation with Ooishi-san...)

TextJPN: 俺の返事がなかったが、部屋にいることはわかっていたので、親父はレナにあがってもらった。
TextENG: I didn't reply, but he knew I was in my room, so he had her come inside.

TextJPN: …そして俺の部屋は２階の奥だと教えた。
TextENG: ...Then told her my room was on the second floor.

TextJPN: ……レナは親父にお礼を言って、階段を上がった…。
TextENG: ...She thanked my dad and went upstairs...

TextJPN: そして小１時間して。
TextENG: Then about an hour passed.

TextJPN: …お茶を持って上がってきた親父とすれ違い、帰って行った。
TextENG: ...She passed by my dad just as he was bringing up tea and left.

TextJPN: 階段を上がってから、小一時間。
TextENG: She came upstairs and about an hour passed.

TextJPN: それから親父とすれ違って、帰宅。
TextENG: Then passed by my dad and returned home.

TextJPN: じゃ……じゃあ、…階段を上がってから…帰るまで……レナは…どこに居たんだよ…？
TextENG: Th... Then... after she came upstairs... and until she left... where was... Rena...?

TextJPN: 俺の部屋と階段の間には……狭い廊下があるだけだ。
TextENG: There's only a short hallway... between my room and the stairs.

TextJPN: つまり……レナは………小１時間もの間………廊下に、…いや、…俺の部屋の前にずーっと立っていたわけだ……。
TextENG: Meaning... Rena had... For about an hour... ..In the hall... ...No... she couldn't have been standing in front of my door all that time...

TextJPN: 俺の部屋の扉はいい加減だ。
TextENG: The door to my room wasn't particularly thick.

TextJPN: 中での話し声はほとんど素通しだろう。
TextENG: You could easily hear everything being said inside.

TextJPN: ……大石さんとしていた、不穏な、不用意な数々の会話が頭を過ぎる……。
TextENG: ...All of the unsettling and unguarded things I spoke to Ooishi-san about began rushing through my head...

TextJPN: 「お父さん、あまりからかっちゃ駄目よ。@k@vS01/00/122700009.………それより、アトリエを片付けてー。@k@vS01/00/122700010.またこぼすわよー」
TextENG: ``Honey, don't tease him.@k@vS01/00/122700009. ...More importantly, you need to clean up your studio.@k@vS01/00/122700010. It's a mess again.``

TextJPN: 階下のお袋が親父を呼ぶ。
TextENG: Mom yelled up at Dad from downstairs.

TextJPN: 親父は、残念そうに笑うとお盆を残したまま下りて行った。
TextENG: Dad left the tray with me and went downstairs with a disappointed chortle.

TextJPN: 親父が部屋を出て行くのを目で追いながら、……レナがずっと立ち尽くしていたかもしれない、廊下の床を見る。
TextENG: I followed my dad out of the room with my eyes... I looked down at the floor around the doorway where Rena might have stood all that time.

TextJPN: さっき…俺が大石さんと話していた時…背中の向こう、わずか２００センチのところに……ずっとレナが立っていた……？
TextENG: Just now... as I was talking to Ooishi-san... With my back turned, Rena was standing a mere six feet away... the whole time...?

TextJPN: こんな薄暗い廊下に、ずっと……？
TextENG: All that time... in this dimly lit doorway...?

TextJPN: 何を見て？
TextENG: What did she see?

TextJPN: 何を聞いて？
TextENG: What did she hear?

TextJPN: 何の為に？
TextENG: For what reason?

TextJPN: ２人分のティーカップのほのかな湯気が、不吉な形にぐにゃりと歪みながら、俺の部屋いっぱいに紅茶の香りを満たしていった……。
TextENG: As the steam from the two teacups ominously wafted and twisted... the aroma of black tea filled my room...
